Title: N/A

reviewText: These programs are a few years old but I just stumbled upon them this past year.  I must say that they are a valuable addition to my collection.  They are geared more towards beginners or those looking for light exercise but as I age I am realizing the importance of having workouts for lighter days.  I work full time plus I am a part time college student now so these 20 minute programs are just what I need some days.This program is a 10 DVD set, you get 3 cardio workouts (Move It, Power Up, Speed Burn), 3 core workouts (Body Balance, Pure Power, Core Express), and 4 sculpting workouts (Strong Push, Strong Pull, Lower Body Blast & Upper Body Blast).  Many of the programs are similar to the original PowerFit series.  But this series has a lot more variety to offer with the cardio and core workouts, which is the primary reason I picked up this set.  Also the strength workouts are split up into 2 day muscle splits, where the original was split into a 3 day.  I like having both options personally but many may appreciate the fact they can hit the entire body in 2 sessions rather than 3.These workouts are geared towards beginners, but they are suitable for intermediates and beyond.  I wasn't sure that I would like using resistance bands instead of dumbells but I do!  Three bands are included, a light, medium and heavy band.  So far I have only used the medium bands so I can't comment on the effectiveness of the others.The cardio workouts are primarily low impact, which I appreciate.  The band is used as an imaginary step, I usually pull out my step and use that just to bump it up a little.  The cardio transitions from step to floor nicely, and it's actually a little easier for me.  The idea is to not step on the band, but over it.  Yeah, that was easier said than done for me, but I am kind of a clutz anyway.The program also comes with a meal plan.  I haven't followed but it offers a lot of variety and I think would be quite easy to follow.  There are lots of carbs and protein include which are helpful for energy.Stephanie Huckabee is known for her days as a Firm instructor.  She was one of my favorite Firm leads, and I really enjoy her in this series.  Some familiar with the Firm will recognize some of the Firm speak, but this just made it easier for me to get used to the workouts.I am a big fan of the PowerFit series and I have acquired all three.  Do you need all three?  Not necessarily, it just depends what you are after.  With 10 workouts you get a lot more variety than the original series.  My only complaint is that each 20 minute workout is on one DVD, I think 2 or more workouts could have easily fit on one disc.  It would saved a lot of space, especially as I find some of my DVDs falling out of the case from time to time.  This is a minor irritant but what can you do.I give this series 5 stars all the way, I highly recommend!
summary: Great addition to original PowerFit series!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This set has 3 cardio workouts and 7 compound strength workouts.I use a 6" step instead of the band on the floor for the cardio step moves and it really bumps up the intensity! If you are used to the Firm and Stephanie as a Firm Master Instructor-you will recognize her excellent cueing and her choreography. These are excellent, time-efficient programs. I am used to working out so I do not follow the workout schedule. I usually would do 2 of these workouts back to back for one workout session. I use these in conjuction with many other workout DVDs in my collection. I never follow pre-set rotations-I get too bored and need variety.  I would use these on a weekly basis in my rotation for sure. I really like Stephanie as an instructor and her workouts are safe and effective!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been looking for some time for the perfect workout to do in the mornings or in times when I just need something quick to do without the difficulty factor! I like to do a 20-30 minute workouts in the mornings, MWF-Resistance/Cardio Mix & TTHF-Interval Cardio. In the mornings I want to do a short workout that will get my heart rate up a bit, loosen my body up and burn a few calories. Staying in the low numbers within my burn zone is what I want to do. Mid day or so I will do a Pilates, Yoga, Zumba or whatever I feel like from the other DVD's that I own and late evening I usually watch one of my favorite shows from my treadmill walking at a steady pace and getting my heart rate up again. This method is one that my body LOVES and responds to without fail. It doesn't leave me feeling like I wanna pass out but instead keeps me energized and feeling awesome all day long and it keeps the scale moving at about 2-2.5 lbs a week and I am 52 years old! These DVD's fit the bill totally! This set comes with 10 DVDs tucked neatly inside a nice folder and all of them are 20 minutes long. They are: Cardio-Move it, Sculpt-Strong Push, Core-Body Balance, Sculpt-Strong Pull, Cardio-Power Up, Core-Pure Power, Sculpt-Lower Body Blast, Cardio-Speed Burn, Sculpt-Upper Body Blast, and Core-Core Express, all just 20 minutes! I love Stephanie, the instructor. She is pleasant and motivating without being intimidating. I bought this set used here on Amazon so I think I paid maybe six dollars total including shipping and handling! I own about 210 fitness DVDS and this set is one that I will be using very often in my short morning workouts or when I just don't feel like working out but will do a lil something. I am an Intermediate Exerciser so this so very do-able for me and I think it would be also doable for a Beginner. I would say that it may be a bit more challenging than say Leslie's very Beginner Walking -DVD's but not much at all. Very happy that I purchased this set. This set is ABSOLUTELY not for the P-90X-ERS, Charlene lovers, etc. These workouts are for the Beginner & Beginner/Intermediates who wants a more gentle workout!
summary: LOVEEEEEEEE this!!! Let me tell you why...
